pr_title: Set target_session_id and target_attempt_id when require op is called

timeline.message: Set target_session_id and target_attempt_id when require op kicks a new attempt
Set target_session_id and target_attempt_id when require op waits for an attempt
Set target_session_id and target_attempt_id when require op waits for an attempt
Set target_session_id and target_attempt_id when require op waits for an attempt
Add tests for StateParams of require task
Add tests for StateParams of require task

timeline.bodyText: May be attemptId.toString() or attemptId.get() is enough ?
timeline.author: yoyama

replies.bodyText:
Agreed. This code follows the existing style.

  
    
      digdag/digdag-tests/src/test/java/acceptance/RequireIT.java
    
    
         Line 107
      in
      c978727
    
    
    
    

        
          
           String.valueOf(attemptId)); 
        
    
  


I'm going to fix my code.
replies.author: hkdnet

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/digdag-tests/src/test/java/acceptance/RequireIT.java b/digdag-tests/src/test/java/acceptance/RequireIT.java
index 49b9dfa606..37e154c797 100644
--- a/digdag-tests/src/test/java/acceptance/RequireIT.java
+++ b/digdag-tests/src/test/java/acceptance/RequireIT.java

@@ -122,7 +122,7 @@ public class RequireIT
         CommandStatus attemptTasks = main("tasks",
                 "-c", config.toString(),
                 "-e", server.endpoint(),
-                String.valueOf(attemptId));
+                attemptId.toString());
 
         List<Config> stateParams = getStateParams(attemptTasks);

timeline.author: yoyama

timeline.bodyText: Increase the maximum wait to 60 may be better. We sometimes faces timeout because of CI performance.
timeline.author: yoyama

timeline.message: Update timeout value to make CI stable

timeline.bodyText:
I guess the purpose of this test is that we can get correct session_id and attempt_id when the session of the child already exists and require> will not kick by itself. So change the test name may be better.
In addition, this implementation does not assure parent will wait for child or not. Because the child workflow is very short and it is not certain whether the status of child is running or stopped when the parent session starts.
So 'waiting' is not correct in my understand.
timeline.author: yoyama

replies.bodyText:
I guess the purpose of this test is that we can get correct session_id and attempt_id when the session of the child already exists and require> will not kick by itself

Yes 👍

'waiting' is not correct in my understand

I misunderstood the behavior, sorry. The parent doesn't wait for the child unless the parent actually kicks the child.
I will rename the test name and delete assertions that are based on the assumption the child finished successfully.
replies.author: hkdnet

replies.bodyText:
Sorry, I misread your comment... 🙈
The parent always waits for the child. It's independent of whether the parent kicks the child or not.
Will just rename the test case.
replies.author: hkdnet

timeline.message:
Rename a test case

because if the child finishes earlier than the require operation,
the parent doesn't wait for the child's completion.
